AccessControlBadConfirmation().details: The caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}.

AddressEmptyCode(address).details: There's no code at `target` (it is not a contract).

AddressInsufficientBalance(address).details: The ETH balance of the account is not enough to perform the operation.

FailedInnerCall().details: A call to an address target failed. The target may have reverted.

SafeERC20FailedOperation(address).details: An operation with an ERC20 token failed.

RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32.details: Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted signaling this.

RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call, an admin role bearer except when using {AccessControl-_setupRole}.

RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)

computeLatestVestingScheduleIdForHolder(.details: Computes the latest vesting schedule identifier for a given holder address.

computeNextVestingScheduleIdForHolder(ad.details: Computes the next vesting schedule identifier for a given holder address.

computeVestingScheduleIdForAddressAndInd.details: Computes the vesting schedule identifier for an address and an index.

params.token_: address of the ERC20 token contract

params._amount: total amount of tokens to be released at the end of the vesting
params._beneficiary: address of the beneficiary to whom vested tokens are transferred
params._cliff: duration in seconds of the cliff in which tokens will begin to vest
params._duration: duration in seconds of the period in which the tokens will vest
params._revocable: whether the vesting is revocable or not
params._slicePeriodSeconds: duration of a slice period for the vesting in seconds
params._start: start time of the vesting period

getLastVestingScheduleForHolder(address).details: Returns the last vesting schedule for a given holder address.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getToken().details: Returns the address of the ERC20 token managed by the vesting contract.

getVestingIdAtIndex(uint256).details: Returns the vesting schedule id at the given index.

getVestingSchedulesCount().details: Returns the number of vesting schedules managed by this contract.

getVestingSchedulesCountByBeneficiary(ad.details: Returns the number of vesting schedules associated to a beneficiary.

returns._0: the total amount of vesting schedules

getWithdrawableAmount().details: Returns the amount of tokens that can be withdrawn by the owner.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

computeReleasableAmount(bytes32).notice: Computes the vested amount of tokens for the given vesting schedule identifier.

createVestingSchedule(address,uint256,ui.notice: Creates a new vesting schedule for a beneficiary.

getVestingSchedule(bytes32).notice: Returns the vesting schedule information for a given identifier.

getVestingScheduleByAddressAndIndex(addr.notice: Returns the vesting schedule information for a given holder and index.

getVestingSchedulesTotalAmount().notice: Returns the total amount of vesting schedules.

revoke(bytes32).notice: Revokes the vesting schedule for given identifier.

withdraw(uint256).notice: Withdraw the specified amount if possible.
